p: Some reports show that C. acaulis is a relatively good accumulator of metals, for example cadmium and silver [ 36, 37]. Therefore, the content of toxic elements in cypselae was assessed. Pb and As were not detected; however, Cd (0.35 ± 0.00 mg/kg), Ni (2.51 ± 0.025 mg/kg), and Al (3.65 ± 0.02 mg/kg) were found. The contents of these metals were relatively low, which can be explained by the protective mechanism of plants preventing accumulation of heavy metals in generative organs [ 4].
